comment.author: 76381637@N08
comment._content:
The ship seems to be very large in relation to circular quay. Were sheep usually
transported out of Sydney? The elevation and size of the ship suggest that it may
be in the late forties. As the sheep are being transported live are they perhaps part of
a special flock.

comment.author: 78690340@N07
comment._content: The photo date is probably 1939 The ferry wharves were reconstructed during the late 1930s, and the foundations constructed for the Circular Quay Railway Station - not completed till 1956 (opening) with the Cahill Expressway in 1958. No wonder the scene looks different! In June 1939 No 4 ferry wharf was nearing completion but reconstruction of No5 had not started. By December 1939 the SMH was reporting that " work was proceeding on the construction of No 4 & No 5 wharves" The large advertising sign on the building to the right of the Customs House is for "Quick", (Berger Quick Enamel), which is similar to the advertisement in the Australian Womens Weekly in July 1933. The brand-name first appears in Trove in 1932 ( in Queensland papers) and is more heavily advertised from 1933. A photo of Circular Quay looking under the Harbour Bridge (opened 1932) [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/7653425520/] has earlier versions of some of the ferry wharves in front of the Customs House.This photo was taken in January 1931. There are 6 steam ferries in Sydney Cove & several more at the wharves, but no cars or ferries at the vehicular ferry dock on the right of the photo. The building next to the Customs House has an advertisement featuring a rampant horse (not Ferrari - possibly Tooths)

comment.author: 78690340@N07
comment._content:
And for comparison a photo of Circular Quay taken  from the Bridge on  
25 March 1932,  the week after the bridge opened:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/kipnewing/6222076319/]

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Thanks for the input on this one! It looks like it might be even later than the 1930s date suggested! The State Library of NSW has a date of 8/6/1950 on the same image. acms.sl.nsw.gov.au//item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=170523
